0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Negotiate with importers to clarify shipment details and ensure compliance with regulations.
Conduct thorough inspections of imported goods to identify potential risks and liabilities.
Prepare and submit customs declarations, including Harmonized System (HS) codes and duty calculations.
Coordinate with shipping lines and carriers to resolve issues related to cargo delivery and pickup.
Verify the authenticity of commercial invoices and other supporting documents for exported goods.
Analyze and interpret regulations, laws, and international trade agreements to ensure compliance.
Maintain accurate records of customs transactions, including shipments, deliveries, and payments.
Respond to inquiries from government agencies, clients, and stakeholders regarding customs-related matters.
Develop and implement effective risk management strategies for high-risk imports and exports.
Provide guidance and training to employees on customs regulations, procedures, and best practices.
Collaborate with colleagues to resolve complex customs-related issues and disputes.
Investigate and report suspicious activity, such as import/export fraud or smuggling.
Monitor changes in tariffs, taxes, and regulations that may impact company operations.
Prepare and submit export declarations, including documentation of compliance with export restrictions.
Develop and manage relationships with government agencies, customs brokers, and other stakeholders.
Ensure compliance with environmental and sustainability regulations related to imports and exports.
Negotiate with clients and suppliers to resolve issues related to payment terms, delivery schedules, and product quality.
Provide expertise and support for company trade missions and export sales teams.
Implement security protocols to protect sensitive customer information and confidential business data.
Verify compliance with anti-money laundering (AML) regulations and internal policies.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of international trade laws, regulations, and standards.
1: Develop and implement a comprehensive training program to enhance employees' knowledge and skills, resulting in improved job performance and reduced turnover rates.
Design and deliver instructor-led training sessions for new hires, ensuring they meet organizational standards and expectations within six months of onboarding.
Conduct needs assessments to identify skill gaps among employees, informing the development of targeted training initiatives that address these areas.
Coordinate and facilitate cross-functional team training sessions, promoting collaboration, communication, and knowledge sharing across departments.
Create engaging online courses and e-learning modules to cater to diverse learning styles, increasing participation rates by 25% within three months.
Establish partnerships with external vendors to provide employees with access to industry-specific certifications, enhancing their job prospects and competitiveness in the market.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to develop training content that aligns with organizational objectives, resulting in a 15% increase in sales performance among trained teams.
Monitor and evaluate training effectiveness, using data-driven insights to inform program adjustments and optimize resource allocation.
Design and implement a mentorship program, pairing experienced employees with new hires for guidance, support, and knowledge transfer.
Conduct regular feedback sessions with trainees, incorporating their suggestions and ideas to improve the overall quality and relevance of training programs.

Develop and maintain a training budget, ensuring that resources are allocated efficiently and effectively to meet organizational objectives, resulting in a 10% reduction in training costs over two years.
2: Prepares and serves meals according to institutional or cafeteria standards.
Maintains a clean and organized kitchen environment, adhering to health and safety protocols.
Receives and processes food orders in a timely manner.
Stocks ingredients and supplies, ensuring sufficient inventory levels.
Operates cooking equipment safely and efficiently, following established recipes and procedures.
Monitors food temperature and presentation during meal preparation and service.
Provides exceptional customer service, responding to dietary restrictions and special requests.
Coordinates with catering teams to prepare for events and functions.
Maintains accurate records of menu offerings, inventory levels, and customer feedback.
Develops and implements new recipes and menus, promoting culinary innovation and variety.
Ensures compliance with food safety regulations and protocols.
Conducts quality control checks on prepared meals, identifying areas for improvement and implementing changes.
